list.title: Five ways bad bots target APIs

list2.desc: APIs are everywhere supporting rapid development and deployment for organizations, but as per a recent survey, they also increase attacks on the surface of the organization, here is how these bad bots target APIs.
Bad bots can be used to scrape the data i.e. sensitive like user data, product information, pricing details, and more that can be used for malicious purposes.

This can be especially dangerous if the API provides access to sensitive data or functionality and can lead to identifying threats or fraud. Account takeover is taking over user accounts by using various techniques, including brute force credential stuffing, Session hacking, and more.
Bad bots can be used to crush APIs with requests and cause them to be unresponsive or even crash disrupting legitimate users’ ability to access the API.
This is not a direct attack, but rather a bad bot that can be used to survey the vulnerabilities that aid attackers in identifying potential vulnerabilities that later can be exploited.
Bad bots can be used to exfiltrate the data by calling APIs that return an excessive amount of data more than what is required for the functioning of API.
